results.title: An Age of Revolutions. Great Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Revolution, nationalism, liberty, war, and industrialisation, were the main themes in the history of Europe from 1789 to 1870. This looks at the effects of the two main revolutions in this time, on the whole of Europe. The French Revolution brought new ideas and politics, and the Industrial Revolution brought new wealth and motives, and an urban industrialised society

results.title: Red line
results.brief_description: Carlton - ‘Imagine if there was a red line behind you’. Short narrative work presenting personal story from Carlton and Parkville. This film is an excerpt from ‘Stories from the hidden city’, a project conceived and directed by Bagryana Popov, 2000-2002.

results.title: Infected
results.material_description: video, circular screen, projection, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Infected is a projected video installation about the nature of the physical body in the context of future technological possibilities, seen through dance and digitally manipulated imagery. The new bio-engineered body is still a sexual, stark, brutal, organic, pounding bloody system with ripping tendons. It is beautiful and repulsive, indulgent, curious, emotional, un/controlled, breeding, changing.

Gina Czarnecki is an artist originating from the UK whose films and installations have been exhibited widely across the UK and around the world. Infected continues her work around the visceral, biological and emotive body and its politics in relation to new technologies.

This video is made in collaboration with Iona Kewney, a Glasgow-based dance artist. It features a specially commissioned score by Fennesz, whose computer-manipulations of sounds derived from guitar and other acoustic sources have won him worldwide acclaim as one of the most innovative and important artists working in electronic music.

results.title: Age of dissent
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin, Guy Glover, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Outspoken views of young men from Canada and Great Britain about what is wrong with the world. Provocative questions of the time are discussed by the young men, some of whom accept the values of our age, others who rebel against a society they call smug, empty and afraid. How the viewpoints of youth differ, individually, and between Canada and Britain are noted by Professor Frank Scott. Edited by Brian Keene.

results.title: The Age of Aquarius
results.brief_description: This survey of the lifestyles of the young focuses on three communes, each of which represents its search for a new way because their lives have been meaningless and empty. The narrator points out that young people believe their search for The Age of Aquarius will save them, if not mankind, from society’s destruction.

results.title: Chairmen = L Age de Chaise
results.creator_credit: Jean Bedard, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An allegory of contemporary society, this animation film shows a society where man has lost his freedom in the struggle to wrest recognition from the very society that is restricting his freedom. The chair is the symbol of success. Without a chair, man is a social outcast. Highly critical of our way of life and modern society, the film questions the present and the future. Complex and innovative animation techniques emphasize the message. A film without words. (Awards: Annecy; Oberhausen; Chicago)

results.title: Against the tide
results.creator_credit: Robert Tronson, Geoffrey Sumner and Interfilm
results.brief_description: Individual responsibility and teamwork are the twin themes in a film which links the continuous needs for safety precautions in the ever present dangers in life in the steel works and on the high seas.

results.title: Against the escarpment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
A view of wildlife, mainly birds, in natural surroundings in Arnhem Land. Includes a discussion of threats to the ecological balance. Birds shown include the black banded pigeon, brolga, ibis, pygmy and magpie geese

results.title: The Afternoon house
results.brief_description: An experimental film showing the fascination of an old house and its garden for a small girl. She goes there to retrieve a lost ball, and wanders about looking at the trees and flowers first, and then going through the Georgian doorway and up the staircase exploring the rooms, looking at the pictures, trying an old fashioned cane chair and then, becoming engrossed in her surroundings, she knocks over a vase of daisies and is frightened as she sees ugly masks staring at her from the walls. She dashes downstairs and out the gate without stopping even to retrieve her ball. Photographed by Mike Browning, music by Allan Lee.
